deIdi2b2.TEXT:
Record date: 2082-04-07
SDU JAR Admission Note
Patient: Fonseca, Linda
DCA MRN: 7090253
Date of Admission: 04/07/82
Attending: Asia Doty
PCP: Austin Jaeger (Whitehouse) Code Status: Full code
CC: chest pain
HPI:
This is a 65 yo female with T2DM, HL, active smoking, breast cancer s/p BL mastectomy and chemoradiation, and a question of a lupus-like disorder who presents with chest pain. She was seated at breakfast this AM when she developed sudden onset ripping chest pain which radiated “like a knife” to her upper back. It was associated with nausea but no vomiting or diaphoresis or shortness of breath. It did radiate down both arms, but she her arm pains are now new. It was not relieved by any positioning, or largely affected by taking deep breaths. It tapered off over about 20 minutes. She felt fatigued and layed down, when it occurred again several hours later, again lasting for about 20 minutes. She then presented to DCA-ED for evaluation. She had a negative adenosine MIBI at JMH in 2078.
She has had a difficult time recently, she is under evaluation for a lupus-like syndrome (she has noted positivity for ANA, anti-smith, anti-dsDNA). She has had progressive joint and muscle pain of all of her major joints (ankes, knees, hips, wrists, elbows, shoulders, neck, lumbar back) and the muscles of her arms and legs. She endorses progressive mental “cloudiness”, frequently dropping items like cutlery and cups, and increasing tremor in her hands.
DCA ED Course:
Initial EKG NSR without ischemic changes
Initial biomarkers strongly positive with CKMB 33 and Troponin 0.36. CXR unremarkable.
She was treated for NSTEMI with ASA 325 mg X 1, heparin gtt, IV lopressor.
She had a brief episode of CP which was relieved by SL NTG and morphine.
She was sent to SDU for further evaluation and treatment.
ROS (positive findings denoted)
Constitutional: fatigue
Head/Eyes: occ dizziness
ENT/Neck: URI sx two weeks ago, chronic neck pain
Chest/Respiratory: See HPI
GI/Abdominal: denies
Cardiovascular: See HPI
Musculoskel/Extr/Back: See HPI
Neuro: See HPI
MEDICAL HISTORY
Hx of pancreatitis
Question of SLE; (+) ANA, dsdna, smith;
Breast ca
- s/p bilateral mastectomies w/positive nodes
- s/p chemoradiation on femara
Depression and anxiety
T2DM; insulin-requiring
Hyperlipidemia
h/o back pain
h/o ear infection s/p Augmentin
FAMILY HISTORY
Mom: stroke, CAD/CABG
Dad: CAD/CABG, DM, lymphoma
SOCIAL HISTORY
Lives with 90 yo mother and cousin.
Etoh - denies
Tobacco – ½ PPD, down from > 2 ppd.
Drugs - denies
ALLERGIES:
Tricyclic Antidepressants - cough,
Sulfa - Rash,
EZETIMIBE - lethargy, GI Intolerance
MEDICATIONS ON ADMISSION
1. Asa (Acetylsalicylic Acid) 81 MG PO QD
2. Clonazepam PO as directed prn
PAML medication information: unit strength: 1MG form: TABLET take: 1 Tablet(s)
Take one half tab twice a day and half tab upto twice a day. if needed for anxiety. #QJ1829196
3. Cyclobenzaprine Hcl 5 MG PO as directed
1 hs for 5 nights, the 1 tid thereafter
4. Humulin N (Insulin Nph Human) Variable SC
40 UNITS QAM x HOURS
22 UNITS QPM x HOURS
5. Insulin Regular Human (Humulin R) Variable SC
20 UNITS QAM x HOURS
16 UNITS QPM x HOURS
6. Letrozole 2.5 MG PO QD
7. Omeprazole Otc (Prilosec Otc) 20 MG PO Q12H
8. Simvastatin 40 MG PO QHS
9. Topiramate (Topamax) 50 MG PO TID
Take two tabs in AM and two tabs at night.
10. Effexor (Venlafaxine Hcl) 150MG PO BID
Take two tabs twice a day.
PHYSICAL EXAM
VITALS: T-98 BP-134/60R 125/55L P-55 SAO2 100 % on RA
GEN’L: awake, alert pleasant, in no distress
HEENT: JVD not elevated, no carotid bruits
Heart: bradycardic, regular, no murmurs (no diastolic murmur at RUSB while leaning forward). Endorses tenderness to pressure on sternum (different from CP earlier today)
LUNG: CTAB no wheezes. s/p BL mastectomy
ABD: obese, soft, nontender, +BS
EXT: warm without edema, 2+ DP pulses bilaterally
NEURO: A&OX3, CN unremarkable, no dysmetria, no obvious tremor on examination
· Chemistries:
Plasma Sodium 135 (135-145) mmol/L
Plasma Potassium 4.3 (3.4-4.8) mmol/L
Plasma Chloride 100 (100-108) mmol/L
Plasma Carbon Dioxide 24.0 (23.0-31.9) mmol/L
Plasma Anion GAP 11 (3-15) mmol/L
Calcium 10.0 (8.5-10.5) mg/dl
Plasma Urea Nitrogen 16 (8-25) mg/dl
Plasma Creatinine 1.01 (0.60-1.50) mg/dl
eGFR 58 mL/min/1.73m2
Plasma Glucose 345 H (70-110) mg/dl
· Cardiac:
Creatine Kinase Isoenzymes 32.8 H (0.0-6.9) ng/ml
CPK Isoenzymes Index 7.7 H (0.0-3.5) %
Troponin-T 0.36 H (<0.03) ng/ml
Creatine Kinase 428 H (40-150) U/L
· Hematology:
WBC 9.0 (4.5-11.0) th/cmm
HCT 44.9 (36.0-46.0) %
HGB 15.1 (12.0-16.0) gm/dl
RBC 4.62 (4.00-5.20) mil/cmm
PLT 202 (150-400) th/cumm
MCV 97 (80-100) fl
Poly 77 H (40-70) %
Lymphs 19 L (22-44) %

· Coags:
Superstat PT 12.9 (10.8-13.4) sec
Superstat PT-INR 1.1
Superstat APTT 25.5 (21.0-33.0) sec
· Imaging: CXR – no acute processes
· EKG: (admit to SDU)
ASSESSMENT & PLAN
This is a 65 yo female with T2DM, HL, active smoking, breast cancer s/p BL mastectomy and chemoradiation, and a question of a lupus-like disorder who presents with chest pain, + troponins, unremarkable EKG. Cardiac RF = age, DM, HL, active smoking. TIMI score = 3 (age, asa use, + biomarkers). DDx = ACS (high risk NSTEMI), aortic dissection (concerning elements of hx), PE (given cancer hx, on SERM), or perimyocarditis (question associated with lupus-like condition). The lack of hypoxia or tachycardia argue against PE. Given her risk factors, after exoneration of her aorta by CT scan, she should undergo cardiac catheterization to assess for epicardial disease. She is currently CP free.
1. Chest pain
- CTA chest to rule out aortic dissection now
- If CTA negative, heparinize, begin integrilin drip (given TIMI of 3), continue ASA, statin, SL nitrate prn, likely coronary catheterization in AM. Cycle serial cardiac enzymes and EKGs.
- If positive, transfer to unit for invasive hemodynamic monitoring, aggressive dP/dT control, and CV surgical consult
- TTE in AM
- Check amylase, lipase
- Risk stratify with HbA1c and FLP in AM
- Smoking cessation consult
2. Lupus-like condition
- Alert rheumatology team to admission in AM
3. DM
- Check HbA1c
- BID NPH and AC+HS RISS
4. Renal
- renal prophylaxis give planned dye loads – mucormyst 1200 BID + IV bicarbonate
5. Psych
- continue home regimen – klonopin, effexor, topamax
Code status – Full code
__________________________________
Eli S Lindsay, MD PhD PGY-2
Pager #46656
